item.description:

Wow, thanks for taking me to school. I appreciate it. TIL :)

item.title: By: Chris Navigato
item.dc:creator: Chris Navigato
item.description: Various forms of one-to-one electronic messaging were used in the 1960...SMTP became widely used in the early 1980s...be patient, great things take time
item.content:encoded: Various forms of one-to-one electronic messaging were used in the 1960…SMTP became widely used in the early 1980s…be patient, great things take time

item.title: By: Robert Kennedy
item.dc:creator: Robert Kennedy
item.description:
Email is actually older than the internet, and was in fact a key technology that spurred the latter's development. An early example is MAILBOX at MIT in around 1965. By 1972 Ray Tomlinson invented the use of the "@" symbol for Arpanet email, an idea and use which of course has persisted to this day.
It wasn't until the early-to-mid nineties, however, that significant public uptake of email occurred--so it took at least 20 years for "adoption" to happen.
Patience, boys!
item.content:encoded:
Email is actually older than the internet, and was in fact a key technology that spurred the latter’s development. An early example is MAILBOX at MIT in around 1965. By 1972 Ray Tomlinson invented the use of the “@” symbol for Arpanet email, an idea and use which of course has persisted to this day.

It wasn’t until the early-to-mid nineties, however, that significant public uptake of email occurred–so it took at least 20 years for “adoption” to happen.

Patience, boys!
